召唤，叫来，召集
下令，命令

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词或词组均含有"召集，召唤"之意。
means: call ： 非正式用词，含义广泛，指用说话或呼叫的形式召唤。
summon ： 正式用词，指官方或正式的召集，召集者具有权力或权威性。
send for ： 作"召唤"解时，语气较随便，暗示委派一件工作。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"喊，叫"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: cry, shout, exclaim, roar, scream, shriek, yell, call
means: cry ： 一般指因恐惧、痛苦、惊奇等而喊叫。
shout ： 指有意识地高声喊叫，常用于提出警告、发命令或唤起注意等。
exclaim ： 多指因高兴、愤怒、痛苦、惊讶等突发感情而高声喊叫。
roar ： 指发出大而深沉的声音、吼叫或咆哮。
scream ： 指因恐具、快乐或痛苦而发出的尖叫声。
shriek ： 指因惊恐、痛苦等或其它感情而发出比scream更为尖锐、刺耳的叫声。
yell ： 多指求援、鼓励时的呼叫。也可指因外界因素刺激而发出尖厉声音。
call ： 指大声说话或喊叫，以引起某人的注意。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"命名，称呼"之意。
means: name ： 含义最泛，指给人或物命名以示区别或便于记忆。
call ： 指给某人或某物取名字以某人或某物的特征称呼。
designate ： 指用特别的名字、符号或词句来称某人或某物。

word_mean: 在通信中用户请求接续并得到响应。

sentence.Network_en: Listen here, young lady. Don't you call me that!
sentence.Network_cn: 你给我听着，小姐。别那样叫我！

sentence.Network_en: Melanie promised that she would call them in the morning.
sentence.Network_cn: 梅拉妮许诺第二天上午给他们打电话。

sentence.Network_en: They call rowing the perfect sport. It exercises every major muscle group.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们称划船是最佳运动，它可以锻炼每一处主要肌肉群。

jx.jx_en_mean: To communicate the need for (someone) to return from one situation or location to a previous one
jx.jx_cn_mean: 召回：通知需要（某人）从现状或位置返回到先前的状况或位置

lj.lj_ly: Management called the laid-off workers back.
lj.lj_ls: 经理召回了被解雇的工人们

jx.jx_en_mean: To telephone or radio (a person) who has called previously
jx.jx_cn_mean: 回电话：打电话或回信号给先前曾打来电话的（某人）

lj.lj_ly: I called her back at noon.
lj.lj_ls: 中午我回她电话

jx.jx_en_mean: To recall (a defective product) for repair
jx.jx_cn_mean: 收回处理：调回（有缺陷的产品）以供修复

lj.lj_ly: The company has called back all such models built in 1990.
lj.lj_ls: 公司已收回所有1990年的机型以便修理

jx.jx_en_mean: To find fault with; reprimand

lj.lj_ly: The teacher called me down for disobedience.
lj.lj_ls: 因我不听话，老师训斥了我

jx.jx_en_mean: To invoke, as from heaven.
To appear, as on someone else's premises, in order to get
jx.jx_cn_mean: 去拿：出现在他人房舍内以图有所得

lj.lj_ly: My chauffeur will call for you at seven.
lj.lj_ls: 我的汽车司机七点钟会到你那儿去取

jx.jx_en_mean: To be an appropriate occasion for
jx.jx_cn_mean: 适合采取：是一恰当的机会

lj.lj_ly: This news calls for champagne.
lj.lj_ls: 这个消息值得开香槟酒庆祝

jx.jx_en_mean: To require; demand

lj.lj_ly: work that calls for patience.
lj.lj_ls: 需要耐心的工作

jx.jx_en_mean: To evoke; elicit

lj.lj_ly: a love song that calls forth sad memories.
lj.lj_ls: 一首引起我悲伤回忆的爱情歌曲

jx.jx_en_mean: To take out of circulation

lj.lj_ly: calling in silver dollars.
lj.lj_ls: 回收银币

jx.jx_en_mean: To summon for assistance or consultation
jx.jx_cn_mean: 邀请：召来做助手或顾问

lj.lj_ly: call in a specialist.
lj.lj_ls: 邀请一个专家

jx.jx_en_mean: To communicate with another by telephone
jx.jx_cn_mean: 打电话：用电话与别人联系

lj.lj_ly: Has the boss called in today?
lj.lj_ls: 老板今天打电话来了吗?

jx.jx_en_mean: To cancel or postpone

lj.lj_ly: call off a trip; called the trip off.
lj.lj_ls: 取消旅游；推迟旅游

jx.jx_en_mean: To restrain or recall

lj.lj_ly: Call off your dogs.
lj.lj_ls: 叫住你的狗

jx.jx_en_mean: To cause to assemble; summon

lj.lj_ly: call out the guard.
lj.lj_ls: 将卫兵集合起来

jx.jx_en_mean: To challenge to a duel.
To summon to active military service

lj.lj_ly: called up reserve troops for active duty.
lj.lj_ls: 征召后备役军人服役

jx.jx_en_mean: To cause one to remember; bring to mind
jx.jx_cn_mean: 唤起：使人忆起；带入心中

lj.lj_ly: stories that call up old times.
lj.lj_ls: 使人怀旧的故事

jx.jx_en_mean: To bring forth for action or discussion; raise.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 提交，提出：拿出来供采取行动或讨论；提出

jx.jx_en_mean: To order; require

lj.lj_ly: I call upon you to tell the truth.
lj.lj_ls: 我要求你说真话

jx.jx_en_mean: To make a demand or a series of demands on
jx.jx_cn_mean: 需要：一项或一系列的需要

lj.lj_ly: Social institutions are now being called upon to provide assistance to the homeless.
lj.lj_ls: 社会机构现在被要求向无家可归者提供帮助

jx.jx_en_mean: another way of saying on call (sense 2)
cause people to notice

lj.lj_ly: he is seeking to call attention to himself by his crimes.
lj.lj_ls: 他想用犯罪的方法来使自己受到关注。

lj.lj_ly: he is seeking to call attention to himself by his crimes.
lj.lj_ls: 他想用犯罪的方法来使自己受到关注。

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer.)make a telephone call reversing the charges
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美)打由受话人付款的电话

jx.jx_en_mean: cause or require something to start working so that one can make use of it
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使（或要求）…开始运作，启用

lj.lj_ly: our active participation as spectators is called into play. .
lj.lj_ls: 我们作为观众的积极参与发挥了作用。

呼唤;打电话

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English ceallian, from Old Norse kalla 'summon loudly'

encyclopedia.content: REMOTE CALL CALL通常指REMOTE CALL、游戏CALL，指一种注入外部EXE程序从外部调用函数的技术。 找CALL一般使用OD等工具，而CALL的使用一般需要编写复杂的汇编代码，在快手(AAuto Quicker) 中推出了一种通用CALL技术，可以象声明WIN API一样声明CALL.下面是一个简单的示例： //外部CALL读取命令行 //列出所有已运行进程的命令行参数 import winex; io.open() //遍历所有窗口 for hwnd,title,theadId,processId in winex.each( ) {

entry.tran: 叫;称呼;将…命名;给…起名字
entry.def: If you call someone or something by a particular name or title, you give them that name or title.

example.ex: I always wanted to call the dog Mufty for some reason...
example.tran: 不知怎么的,我老想把这条狗唤作穆夫提。

example.ex: 'Doctor...' — 'Will you please call me Sarah?'...
example.tran: “大夫…”——“就叫我萨拉好了。”

entry.def: If you call someone or something a particular thing, you suggest they are that thing or describe them as that thing.

example.ex: The speech was interrupted by members of the Conservative Party, who called him a traitor...
example.tran: 演说被保守党人士打断,他们称他是叛徒。

example.ex: I wouldn't call it a burden; I call it a responsibility...
example.tran: 我不觉得这是负担;我觉得它是一种责任。

entry.def: If you call something, you say it in a loud voice, because you are trying to attract someone's attention.

example.ex: He could hear the others downstairs in different parts of the house calling his name...
example.tran: 他听到其他人从楼下不同地方喊他的名字。

example.ex: 'Boys!' she called again.
example.tran: “小子们!”她又叫道。

entry.def: If you call someone, you telephone them.

example.ex: Would you call me as soon as you find out?...
example.tran: 你一弄清楚了就给我打电话好吗?

example.ex: A friend of mine gave me this number to call...
example.tran: 一个朋友要我打这个号码。

entry.def: If you call someone such as a doctor or the police, you ask them to come to you, usually by telephoning them.

example.ex: He screamed for his wife to call an ambulance...
example.tran: 他尖叫着让他老婆打电话叫救护车。

example.ex: One night he was called to see a woman with tuberculosis.
example.tran: 一天夜里,有人打来电话,请他去给一位患肺结核的妇女看病。

entry.def: If you call someone, you ask them to come to you by shouting to them.

example.ex: She called her young son: 'Here, Stephen, come and look at this!'...
example.tran: 她喊她的小儿子:“喂,斯蒂芬,过来看看这个!”

example.ex: He called me over the Tannoy.
example.tran: 他用天朗扩音器喊我。

entry.def: When you make a telephone call, you telephone someone.

example.ex: I made a phone call to the United States to talk to a friend...
example.tran: 我打电话给美国的一个朋友。

example.ex: I've had hundreds of calls from other victims...
example.tran: 我已经接到了其他受害人打来的上百个电话。

entry.tran: 召集(会议、排练等);宣布举行(选举等)
entry.def: If someone in authority calls something such as a meeting, rehearsal, or election, they arrange for it to take place at a particular time.

example.ex: The Committee decided to call a meeting of the All India Congress...
example.tran: 委员会决定召开国大党会议。

example.ex: The RSC was calling a press conference to announce the theatre's closure...
example.tran: 皇家莎士比亚剧团要召开新闻发布会,宣布剧院关闭。

entry.def: If someone is called before a court or committee, they are ordered to appear there, usually to give evidence.

example.ex: The child waited two hours before she was called to give evidence...
example.tran: 小女孩等了两个小时才被传唤进去作证。

example.ex: I was called as an expert witness.
example.tran: 我作为专家证人被传唤出庭。

entry.def: If you call somewhere, you make a short visit there.

example.ex: A market researcher called at the house where he was living...
example.tran: 一位市场调查人员造访了他的住处。

example.ex: Andrew now came almost weekly to call.
example.tran: 现在安德鲁几乎每星期都来。

entry.tran: (火车、公共汽车、船舶)停靠,停留
entry.def: When a train, bus, or ship calls somewhere, it stops there for a short time to allow people to get on or off.

example.ex: The steamer calls at several ports along the way.
example.tran: 一路上,汽船在好几个港口停靠。

entry.def: To call a game or sporting event means to cancel it, for example because of rain or bad light.

example.ex: The second game of the series had ended in a 3-3 tie after ten innings when the game was called on account of darkness...
example.tran: 系列赛第二场在十局过后,双方战成3比3平，此时由于天黑,比赛取消。

example.ex: We called the next game.
example.tran: 我们取消了下一场比赛。

entry.def: If there is a call for something, someone demands that it should happen.

example.ex: There have been calls for a new kind of security arrangement...
example.tran: 不少人呼吁出台新的安全措施。

example.ex: Almost all workers heeded a call by the trade unions to stay at home for the duration of the strike.
example.tran: 工会号召工人在罢工期间呆在家里,几乎所有工人都响应了这一号召。

entry.def: If there is little or no call for something, very few people want it to be done or provided.

example.ex: 'Have you got just plain chocolate?' — 'No, I'm afraid there's not much call for that.'
example.tran: “你们有纯巧克力吗?”——“没有,恐怕那东西没几个人要。”

entry.def: The call of something such as a place is the way it attracts or interests you strongly.

example.ex: You must be feeling exhilarated by the call of the new.
example.tran: 新鲜事物的魅力一定让你兴奋不已。

entry.def: The call of a particular bird or animal is the characteristic sound that it makes.

example.ex: ...the plaintive call of a whale.
example.tran: 鲸的哀鸣

example.ex: ...a wide range of animal noises and bird calls.
example.tran: 各种各样的鸟兽叫声

entry.def: If you have first call on something, you will be asked before anyone else whether you want to buy or use it.

example.ex: Why should they get first call on the best property?
example.tran: 凭什么最好的房产尽着他们先挑?

entry.def: If you say that there is no call for someone to behave in a particular way, you are criticizing their behaviour, usually because you think it is rude.

example.ex: There was no call for him to single you out from all the others.
example.tran: 这么多人中，他不该专挑你。

entry.tran: 随时待命的;随叫随到的
entry.def: If someone is on call, they are ready to go to work at any time if they are needed, especially if there is an emergency.

example.ex: In theory I'm on call day and night.
example.tran: 从理论上说,我现在昼夜待命。

example.ex: ...a doctor on call.
example.tran: 随叫随到的医生

entry.def: If you call in sick, you telephone the place where you work to tell them you will not be coming to work because you are ill.

example.ex: 'Shouldn't you be at work today?' — 'I called in sick.'
example.tran: “你今天不是应该上班的吗?”“我打电话请过病假了。”

means.word_mean: 1. a telephone connection;

sentences.sentence: "she reported several anonymous calls"
"he placed a phone call to London"
"he heard the phone ringing but didn't want to take the call"

means.word_mean: 2. a loud utterance; often in protest or opposition;

sentences.sentence: "the speaker was interrupted by loud cries from the rear of the audience"

means.word_mean: 3. a demand especially in the phrase "the call of duty"
4. the characteristic sound produced by a bird;

sentences.sentence: "a bird will not learn its song unless it hears it at an early age"

means.word_mean: 5. a brief social visit;

sentences.sentence: "senior professors' wives no longer make afternoon calls on newcomers"

means.word_mean: 6. a demand by a broker that a customer deposit enough to bring his margin up to the minimum requirement
7. a demand for a show of hands in a card game;

sentences.sentence: "after two raises there was a call"

means.word_mean: 8. a request;

sentences.sentence: "many calls for Christmas stories"
"not many calls for buggywhips"

means.word_mean: 9. an instruction that interrupts the program being executed;

sentences.sentence: "Pascal performs calls by simply giving the name of the routine to be executed"

means.word_mean: 10. brief visit in an official or professional capacity;

sentences.sentence: "the pastor's visits to his parishioners"
"a visit to a dentist"
"the salesman's call on a customer"

means.word_mean: 11. (sports) the decision made by an umpire or referee;

sentences.sentence: "he was ejected for protesting the call"

means.word_mean: 12. the option to buy a given stock (or stock index or commodity future) at a given price before a given date
1. assign a specified, proper name to;

sentences.sentence: "They named their son David"
"The new school was named after the famous Civil Rights leader"

means.word_mean: 2. get or try to get into communication (with someone) by telephone;

sentences.sentence: "I tried to call you all night"
"Take two aspirin and call me in the morning"

means.word_mean: 3. ascribe a quality to or give a name of a common noun that reflects a quality;

sentences.sentence: "He called me a bastard"
"She called her children lazy and ungrateful"

means.word_mean: 4. order, request, or command to come;

sentences.sentence: "She was called into the director's office"
"Call the police!"

means.word_mean: 5. utter a sudden loud cry;

sentences.sentence: "she cried with pain when the doctor inserted the needle"
"I yelled to her from the window but she couldn't hear me"

means.word_mean: 6. pay a brief visit;

sentences.sentence: "The mayor likes to call on some of the prominent citizens"

means.word_mean: 7. call a meeting; invite or command to meet;

sentences.sentence: "The Wannsee Conference was called to discuss the `Final Solution'"
"The new dean calls meetings every week"

means.word_mean: 8. order or request or give a command for;

sentences.sentence: "The unions called a general strike for Sunday"

means.word_mean: 9. order, summon, or request for a specific duty or activity, work, role;

sentences.sentence: "He was already called 4 times for jury duty"
"They called him to active military duty"

means.word_mean: 10. indicate a decision in regard to;

sentences.sentence: "call balls and strikes behind the plate"

means.word_mean: 11. stop or postpone because of adverse conditions, such as bad weather;

sentences.sentence: "call a football game"

means.word_mean: 12. read aloud to check for omissions or absentees;

sentences.sentence: "Call roll"

means.word_mean: 13. send a message or attempt to reach someone by radio, phone, etc.; make a signal to in order to transmit a message;

sentences.sentence: "Hawaii is calling!"
"A transmitter in Samoa was heard calling"

means.word_mean: 14. declare in the capacity of an umpire or referee;

sentences.sentence: "call a runner out"

means.word_mean: 15. utter a characteristic note or cry;

sentences.sentence: "bluejays called to one another"

means.word_mean: 16. utter in a loud voice or announce;

sentences.sentence: "He called my name"
"The auctioneer called the bids"

means.word_mean: 17. make a prediction about; tell in advance;

sentences.sentence: "Call the outcome of an election"

means.word_mean: 18. challenge (somebody) to make good on a statement; charge with or censure for an offense;

sentences.sentence: "He deserves to be called on that"

means.word_mean: 19. consider or regard as being;

sentences.sentence: "I would not call her beautiful"

means.word_mean: 20. demand payment of (a loan);

sentences.sentence: "Call a loan"

means.word_mean: 21. give the calls (to the dancers) for a square dance
22. greet, as with a prescribed form, title, or name;

sentences.sentence: "He always addresses me with `Sir'"
"Call me Mister"
"She calls him by first name"

means.word_mean: 23. make a stop in a harbour;

sentences.sentence: "The ship will call in Honolulu tomorrow"

means.word_mean: 24. make a demand, as for a card or a suit or a show of hands;

sentences.sentence: "He called his trump"

means.word_mean: 25. require the presentation of for redemption before maturation;

sentences.sentence: "Call a bond"

means.word_mean: 26. lure by imitating the characteristic call of an animal;

sentences.sentence: "Call ducks"

means.word_mean: 27. challenge the sincerity or truthfulness of;

sentences.sentence: "call the speaker on a question of fact"

means.word_mean: 28. rouse somebody from sleep with a call;

sentences.sentence: "I was called at 5 A.M. this morning"

list.explanation: 讲明意图，有言在先，预言事情的结果

example.en: She'll never try to trick you, she always calls her shots.
example.zh: 她决不会想要算计你，她凡事总归有言在先。

example.en: Nothing ever happens as Tom says it will. He is very poor at calling his shots.
example.zh: 汤姆预言的事从未发生。他是个蹩脚得很的预言家。

auth_sentence.content: We used to call it "alternative medicine".
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We used to call it "alternative medicine".

auth_sentence.content: So in that sense you may call that exceptional.
auth_sentence.res_content: So in that sense you may call that exceptional.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So in that sense you may call that exceptional.

auth_sentence.content: They love to call him njamba - meaning hero.
auth_sentence.res_content: They love to call him njamba - meaning hero.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They love to call him njamba - meaning hero.

means.word_mean: 叫, 喊

sentences.en: Why doesn't the servant come when I call?
sentences.cn: 当我叫的时候, 为何仆人没来?

sentences.en: She called and called but no one came to her assistance.
sentences.cn: 她叫了又叫, 但没有人来帮忙。

sentences.en: Would you call me a taxi?
sentences.cn: 请给我叫一辆计程车好吗?

sentences.en: Not far away in the woods, a bird called.
sentences.cn: 在不远的林子里有一只鸟在叫。

means.word_mean: 通电话

sentences.en: She promised to call at noon.
The office called to find out where you were.
sentences.cn: 办公室打电话来了解你在什么地方。

means.word_mean: 认为; 估计

sentences.en: Are you calling me a liar?
sentences.cn: 你认为我是一个不诚实的人吗?
没有什么事物可认为是不可知的。

sentences.en: They called it silly to do so.

means.word_mean: 命名, 取名

sentences.en: The father called the baby John.
sentences.cn: 父亲给这个婴孩取名约翰。

sentences.en: She had a daughter last year.They call this one Catherine.
sentences.cn: 去年她生了个女孩, 他们叫她凯瑟琳。

means.word_mean: 召唤, 号召, 召开

sentences.en: The sirens are calling the men to assemble.
sentences.cn: 警报声在召令士兵集合。

means.word_mean: 拜访, 访问

sentences.en: Did any one call when I was out?
sentences.cn: 我不在的时候有人来过吗?

sentences.en: I called to see Mr. Green.

means.word_mean: 呼喊声, 叫声; 鸟鸣声

sentences.en: I heard a call for help.

jushi.english: Not far away in the woods, a bird called.
jushi.chinese: 在不远的林子里有一只鸟在叫。
一个柔和的声音在呼唤。

jushi.english: I've been calling for five minutes.
